TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Size extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Implements a structure that is used to describe the Size of an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Size is particularly useful because it describes both the and of an object. Size is used extensively by the layout system to arrange and measure elements. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *width* A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the of the Size structure. *height* A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the of the Size structure. ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a Size structure in code. [!code-cs[PlotPanel#2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/PlotPanel_csharp/PlotPanel.cs#2)] [!code-cpp[PlotPanel#2](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/plotpanel/PlotPanel.cpp#2)] [!code-vb[PlotPanel#2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/PlotPanel/PlotPanel.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `width` and `height` cannot be negative.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that represents a static empty .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> of the instance of <xref:System.Windows.Size> are equal to negative-infinity when this property is invoked. This is the only situation where <xref:System.Windows.Size> can be a negative number.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this instance of is <xref:System.Windows.Size.Empty%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Even if <xref:System.Windows.Size> is 0, the instance of <xref:System.Windows.Size> will still contain a 0 or 1, indicating a zero- or one-dimensional set of points. Therefore, do not use this property to check for a 0 area.

Docs.returns: if this instance of size is <xref:System.Windows.Size.Empty%2A>; otherwise .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a <xref:System.String> that represents this object.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> that specifies the width followed by the height.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> property is set to 30 and the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> property is set to 40, the ToString method returns a string that says `"30, 40"`.

Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that specifies the width followed by the height.
